column3: Arturo Trujillo (Computer Laboratory, University of Cambridge)
column4: Computing FIRST and FOLLOW Functions for Feature-Theoretic Grammars
column11:
This paper describes an algorithm for the computation of FIRST and FOLLOW
sets for use with feature-theoretic grammars in which the value of the sets
consists of pairs of feature-theoretic categories. The algorithm preserves as
much information from the grammars as possible, using negative restriction to
define equivalence classes. Addition of a simple data structure leads to an
order of magnitude improvement in execution time over a naive implementation.

column3: G.M. D'Ariano, M.Fortunato and P. Tombesi
column4:
Time Evolution of an Anharmonic Oscillator Interacting with a Squeezed
  Bath
column5:
4 pages, RevTeX 3.0 with twocolumn option, Rome I preprint N. 999-94
  (4 postscript figures included in a uuencoded tar-compressed separate file)
column11:
The evolution of a single mode of the electromagnetic field interacting with
a squeezed bath in a Kerr medium is considered. The solution of the
corresponding master equation is given numerically. It is argued that the
creation of a superposition state (Schr\"odinger's cat) is better achieved in
presence of a squeezed reservoir than of a thermal one.

column3: G.M. D'Ariano, M.Fortunato and P. Tombesi
column4: Isotropic Phase-Number Squeezing and Macroscopic Quantum Coherence
column5:
4 pages, RevTeX 3.0 with twocolumn option (5 postscript figures
  included in a uuencoded tar-compressed separate file), Rome I preprint N.
  1043-94
column11:
A new master equation performing isotropic phase-number squeezing is
suggested. The phase properties of coherent superpositions are analyzed when
the state evolves in presence of a bath with fluctuations squeezed in this
isotropic way. We find that such a reservoir greatly improves persistence of
coherence with respect to either a customary thermal bath, or to an
anisotropically squeezed phase-sensitive bath.

column4: A truly marginal deformation of SL(2,R) in a null direction
column5: 6 pages, RI-8-94 (One reference and two footnotes added.)
column11:
We perform a marginal deformation of the SL(2,R) WZW model in a null
direction. If we send the deformation parameter to infinity we obtain a linear
dilaton background plus two free bosons. We show in addition that such a
background can be obtained by a duality transformation of the undeformed WZW
model. In the end we indicate how to generalize the given procedure.

column3:
H. Garc\'ia-Compe\'an, J.M. L\'opez-Romero, M.A. Rodr\'iguez-Segura
  and M. Socolovsky
column4: Principal Bundles, Connections and BRST Cohomology
column11:
We review the elementary theory of gauge fields and the Becchi-Rouet-Stora-
Tyutin symmetry in the context of differential geometry. We emphasize the
topological nature of this symmetry and discuss a double Chevalley-Eilenberg
complex for it.
